name: Islamic Society of Greater Houston
mission: Helping the community to live sustainable lives.
zakatClaimEvidence: As part of its zakat services, the ISGH has special food stamps which can be used to pay bills and rent, bus fare, and items from Muslim grocery stores. They have a system in place to receive their zaka. money and an online system to pay it. In 2024, ISGH was among the largest providers of financial assistance in our community with over $4.9M in Zakat and Sadaqah distributions. The ISGH website also lists 'ISGH Zakat Ul Maal' under 'Online Giving' and provides an 'ISGH Assistance Application' with an email address 'zakat@isgh.org' for submitting zakat requests. (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGLB5ffemMFN7ZaGRUjlLW6W1yEfMuBTmXW83DPQsp1hQ-J_gttvRvmWpfnHlXbc-W2BP1AG-9NV43fu1ZnN52nwXw_nKnoF_JPgrI8awMKZtkE_BYV4ZvHTR_ujnGLF4Zrrf6DcZMo2T1AExcswvaV8aRyJLgtth_laDk=)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Limited match due to weaker results and/or higher uncertainty; review methodology details before deciding.

components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish operating-reserve levels and adopt a board-approved reserve policy (typically 3-12 months for most nonprofits).

score_details.score_summary: Islamic Society of Greater Houston shows moderate alignment and limited impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: As part of its zakat services, the ISGH has special food stamps which can be used to pay bills and rent, bus fare, and items from Muslim grocery stores. They have a system in place to receive their zaka. money and an online system to pay it. In 2024, ISGH was among the largest providers of financial assistance in our community with over $4.9M in Zakat and Sadaqah distributions. The ISGH website also lists 'ISGH Zakat Ul Maal' under 'Online Giving' and provides an 'ISGH Assistance Application' with an email address 'zakat@isgh.org' for submitting zakat requests. (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGLB5ffemMFN7ZaGRUjlLW6W1yEfMuBTmXW83DPQsp1hQ-J_gttvRvmWpfnHlXbc-W2BP1AG-9NV43fu1ZnN52nwXw_nKnoF_JPgrI8awMKZtkE_BYV4ZvHTR_ujnGLF4Zrrf6DcZMo2T1AExcswvaV8aRyJLgtth_laDk=)

all_citations.claim: The organization provides weekend school enrollment, Quran distribution, and total assistance to help the community live sustainable lives.
The organization offers various donation options including Zakat-Ul-Maal and support for funeral services.
The organization's profile metadata and financial fields are listed, though specific rating scores are not provided.
Financial data, including revenue and expenses, are documented in the organization's tax filings.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization receives a score of 36/100, reflecting a strong community presence and religious alignment balanced against significant gaps in public financial data and impact transparency.
areas_for_improvement: Limited transparency regarding detailed financial metrics and program expense ratios
Low data confidence due to missing third-party financial evaluations

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 26/50, the charity demonstrates a medium fit for donors seeking to support religious and cultural causes in the Greater Houston area [1][2]. While the cause urgency is high for the local Muslim community, the overall score is moderated by the need for more robust financial reporting [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building through educational enrollment and the distribution of assistance, though the cost per beneficiary remains unavailable [1][3]. The impact score of 15/50 reflects a lack of third-party verification and limited evidence regarding the long-term effectiveness of its social programs [3][4].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Islamic Society of Greater Houston serves as a central pillar for the Muslim community in Texas, providing essential religious services and social welfare programs.
strengths: Established provider of essential religious services including weekend schools and Quran distribution
Maintains a broad infrastructure for community welfare, including dedicated funeral and cemetery services
Verified zakat-eligible status for Islamic charitable giving
baseline_narrative.summary: The Islamic Society of Greater Houston (ISGH) is dedicated to helping the community live sustainable lives through comprehensive social and religious programming [1]. As a zakat-eligible organization, it facilitates the distribution of Zakat-Ul-Maal and manages critical community infrastructure, including funeral services and cemetery development [1][2].
